summary: Complete GIS mapping system: interactive web maps with fire perimeters, probability contours, and mobile support

content.name: fire_perimeter_extraction_marching_squares
content.description: Extract smooth fire boundaries using marching squares algorithm

metadata.input: Boolean burned array + geographic bounding box
metadata.output: List of (lon, lat) coordinates forming polygon
metadata.advantage: Smooth boundaries, not jagged pixel edges

content.name: burn_probability_contour_levels
content.description: Standard probability contours for operational fire management

content.name: folium_leaflet_web_mapping
content.description: Python wrapper for Leaflet.js to create interactive web maps

metadata.image_encoding: RGBA numpy array → PIL Image → base64 PNG
metadata.transparency: Alpha channel based on burn probability

content.name: rgba_transparency_for_probability
content.description: Use alpha channel to show probability intensity

metadata.effect: High probability = opaque, low probability = transparent
metadata.why: Allows base map to show through low-probability areas

content.name: geographic_coordinate_conversion
content.description: Convert pixel coordinates to lon/lat for GIS export

learning_events.content: Interactive web maps are mobile-friendly and require no GIS software - crucial for field operations

metadata.advantage: Fire managers can view on phones/tablets
metadata.shareability: Single HTML file can be emailed or hosted
metadata.touch_support: Pinch to zoom, swipe to pan on mobile

content.name: multiple_fire_perimeters_for_uncertainty
content.description: Show multiple perimeter thresholds to communicate uncertainty

learning_events.content: Custom legends in web maps must be position:fixed to stay visible when zooming/panning

metadata.styling: White background, border, shadow for readability
